Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Founded in 1904, Brighton was born to serve a diverse set of needs from agriculture, pioneers, railroads and commerce, becoming a hub in what is now Adam’s County. Due to its proximity to Denver International Airport and several major cross-country highways, it has developed into a blossoming energy and automation industry center—providing a cost-effective relocation alternative for firms and families. Although only a 25-minute drive to downtown Denver, Brighton has maintained its small town charm through its arts and music scene, historic downtown, local farm experiences and state parks.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Located at the heart of Northern Colorado just off of I-25 at the Crossroads exit, this 1,300 SF space is ideal for a variety of retail and commercial uses. The I-25 exit to Crossroads Boulevard was recently completed which has set up this area for success.

Within 2 miles of the building are a number of large employers such as a Walmart Distribution Center, the UCHealth Medical Center, Northern Colorado Regional Airport, Heska Corporation, Nutrien, Beckman Coulter, the U.S. Army Reserve Training Center and more. The presence of these employers heightens the visibility of this building.

In that same 2 mile radius, there are almost a dozen restaurants and activity centers which draw more than 16,000 VPD on Crossroads Boulevard.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Prime Central Northern Colorado Location

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Johnstown Plaza made a statement since it was built in 2016. A super-star line up of merchants, restaurants, and service providers
makes this shopping center the destination for the growing Northern Colorado population and beyond. Anchored by a 250K
square foot Scheel’s Outdoor Store, Burlington Coat Factory, At Home and Hobby Lobby, Johnstown Plaza draws a wide and
deep customer base from Fort Collins, Wyoming, Greeley, Loveland and communities in-between.
Located within the burgeoning 600 acre mixed-use community aptly named 2534 for it’s ideal location at I-25 and Highway 34,
the development includes multifamily housing, offices, hotels, medical offices and businesses seeking synergy and opportunity
along what has been quipped the fastest growing area in Northern Colorado.

PRIME PROPERTY AVAILABLE

153 Acre Mixed-Use Development Prime Property Available! Top national retailers, such as In-N-Out Burger, Ent Federal Credit Union and Penrose-St. Francis Health Services, are building facilities in this rapidly developing area off I-25 on the southeast corner of Interquest & Voyager Parkway. In recent years, this area has emerged as one of the city’s hottest residential and commercial hubs; it’s home to increasing numbers of restaurants, stores, hotels, apartments, townhomes and major employers, among others. Come be a part of the winning attitude at Victory Ridge!

Includes:
153-acre development

1.6 million SF of stores, restaurants and offices

125,000 SF office Class A+ building under construction

15-screen ICON Cinema with 106' mega screen

1,100-space parking garage

221 Townhomes

SPACE AVAILABLE IN GRANDVIEW MARKETPLACE!

Grandview Marketplace is located in the city of Colorado Springs, at the highly visible northwest corner of Centennial Boulevard and Fillmore Street. The center, built in 2004, offers a great tenant mix and is anchored by King Soopers. It is located near the new VA hospital with convenient access to I-25 and Garden of the Gods Road.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: This 2,644 square foot freestanding building is situated at the junction of W. Colorado Avenue at 8th Street, just before the gateway into historic Old Colorado City, one of the premier destinations for unique shopping and dining on W. Colorado Ave.

Or, head south on 8th Street into the westside’s major shopping corridor between Hwy 24 and Motor City Drive featuring major retailers such as Walmart Supercenter, Hobby Lobby, Texas Roadhouse and McDonalds.
This location also offers easy access to downtown, I-25, and western routes into the mountains, which will ensure this property will go fast!

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: This is a great owner/user building and Tenant will vacate at time of sale. The property has its own parking lot, making it convenient to the steady stream of locals and tourists alike.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Just 30 miles from Denver, Boulder is a beautiful, historic city surrounded by the gorgeous Flatiron
Mountains and just moments away from Boulder Creek. Boulder is brimming with wonderful shopping,
dining, and entertainment opportunities — there is truly something for everyone. Downtown Boulder
is well-kept, with over 1000 businesses and a welcoming atmosphere. The Pearl Street Walkway, a
marvelously captivating four-block-long pedestrian mall in the heart of Downtown Boulder, is filled with
colorful, vibrant flowers virtually the entire year. Downtown Boulder is a vibrant and exciting place for
locals and visitors alike.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
SHOPS AT FOUR MILE CREEK, CANON CITY, CO

The Shops at Four Mile Creek is located in the center of Cañon City at the intersection of Highway 50 and Justice Center Road. This prominent shopping plaza provides residents and tourists great shopping, dining and entertainment options. Tourists are drawn to the areas natural beauty along the Arkansas River, including river rafting, numerous parks, hiking, canyons and the famous Royal Gorge Bridge and train ride.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Space Available at Four Mile Creek in Canon City

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Nottingham Station is located in the mountain town of Avon, CO within the Vail Valley within walking distance of several hotels and condominium complexes while maintaining a highly visible, iconic location at the gates to the Beaver Creek Resort. This speciality retail center is conveniently located along the local bus service route and is easily accessible from anywhere within the Avon/Beaver Creek community.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The center encompasses 13,975 SF and is situated on irreplaceable land at the entrance to the world-renowned ski destination, Beaver Creek Resort.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Vail Retail Opportunity

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Aspen is home to world class outdoor activities, luxury
resorts and high-end shopping. The city offers approximately 50 lodging properties, 80 restaurants and bars, and 230 shops/boutiques. The average daily population in Aspen is 20,871 with a high-season population of approximately 27,000. Aspen offers a number of events that attract both visitors and locals including: Aspen Music Festical, Food & Wine Festival, X-Games, and more.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Aspen Retail For Lease
